thread.title: Vietnam Communist Party chief to visit Obama at White House
thread.title_full: Vietnam Communist Party chief to visit Obama at White House | Fox News

author: Associated Press
title: Vietnam Communist Party chief to visit Obama at White House
text:
Published July 07, 2015 Associated Press Email Print The head of Vietnam's Communist Party is heading to the White House on Tuesday for meetings with President Obama and other top officials.
Nguyen Phu Trong is the de facto leader of Vietnam despite holding no official government post. He's in Washington for a visit aimed at boosting ties 20 years after the U.S. and Vietnam normalized relations following the Vietnam War.
Obama plans to host Trong for a morning meeting in the Oval Office. The White House says trade, human rights and defense cooperation are on the agenda.
Vice President Joe Biden will also host Trong for a lunch Tuesday at the State Department. Trong will also attend a dinner hosted by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce while in Washington.
Obama hasn't yet visited Vietnam as president.
